message: I have a new project I am working on and trying to decide between hosting options, EC2, EngineYard or Heroku.  What are people using?

Used Heroku for a new project but the pricing model scales poorly, especially with background jobs.  I'm using Slicehost for quick resizing and striking a balance between the heavy setup of EC2 and the lack of configurability on Heroku.
We use a lot of Linode, which I feel is a good price/performance match.
What type of project are you trying to host. I have quite a few projects hosted on Heroku, extremely happy with them. Heroku is great for launching your app.
Heroku is great. If you want a vps, go with Slicehost or Linode
postgre caused problems for some of our searches though on heroku
we're really happy with rackspace cloud hosting
heroku is always a great choice though
what about price is it a consideration ?
getting it to work quickly > price
Heroku has been great for us! They make it super easy to get up and running.
historically I've set up linodes / other VMs for Rails hosting, but now I'm more inclined to point clients to Heroku/EY/Brightbox
heroku totally rocks! in fact, it's depend on your application architecture.

It really depends what you are building. If you want a quick prototype then Heroku or some other PaaS. If you are looking to build out an existing application then you are better off using your own stack on a generic cloud platform such as Rackspace and EC2
Has anyone tried out engineyard? Why would you use that over heroku?

@georgetang EngineYard gives you a bit more freedom to manage your server. On Heroku you're restricted to their walled garden, it's great for most apps but if you need to write to disk or configure anything differently on your server then you're gonna run into trouble.
We use EY for our biggest apps and Heroku for a new one we're developing. Both are great.
